Scrape Module¶

Scrape GradCafe survey pages into a JSON dataset.

This module uses robots.txt checks, page iteration, and BeautifulSoup to extract structured applicant records from the public survey pages.

src.scrape.check_url(page_url, parser)¶

Fetch a page if allowed by robots.txt and return a BeautifulSoup object.

Parameters:

  • page_url – Page URL to fetch.

  • parser – Robots parser from url_check().

Returns:

bs4.BeautifulSoup or None if blocked/error.

src.scrape.create_pages(page_num)¶

Build the GradCafe survey URL for a given page.

Parameters:

page_num – Page index (1-based).

Returns:

Fully qualified URL for the survey page.

src.scrape.main()¶

Run the scraper with the default target size.

Intended for command-line use.

src.scrape.pull_pages(target_n=50, start_page=1)¶

Pull records from paginated survey pages and save to JSON.

Parameters:

  • target_n – Maximum number of records to collect.

  • start_page – First page to start scraping from.

Returns:

None. Writes OUTPUT_FILE as a JSON array.

src.scrape.scrape_data(soup)¶

Parse the GradCafe results table into structured records.

Parameters:

soup – Parsed HTML document.

Returns:

List of record dicts (possibly empty).

src.scrape.url_check()¶

Create and initialize a robots.txt parser for the GradCafe site.

Returns:

A configured robotparser.RobotFileParser instance.
